    Classroom Roof Collapse in Nakuru East Kills One Pupil

    A tragic classroom roof collapse in Nakuru East leaves one pupil dead and several injured.

    By Zawadi Intel Staff | Jan 18, 2026

    Scene of the collapsed classroom in Nakuru East. Â© Zawadi Intel

    A tragic incident unfolded in Nakuru East when the roof of a classroom collapsed, killing one pupil and injuring several others. The accident has sparked outrage and renewed calls for urgent investment in school infrastructure across Kenya.

    Immediate Response

    Emergency services rushed to the scene, rescuing trapped pupils and transporting the injured to nearby hospitals. Authorities have promised a thorough investigation into the cause of the collapse.

    Community Reaction

    Parents and local leaders expressed grief and anger, demanding accountability from education officials. Many highlighted the poor state of school facilities in rural and periâ€‘urban areas as a longâ€‘standing issue.

    Policy Implications

    The tragedy has reignited debate about Kenyaâ€™s education budget and the need for stricter safety standards. Lawmakers are expected to push for reforms to ensure safer learning environments.
